paper_metadata.title: Drug and Gene Therapy for Treating Variant Transthyretin Amyloidosis (ATTRv) Neuropathy
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: Various ages, both early and late-onset cases
patients.phenotype: Neuropathic phenotype, with early-onset presenting with small sensory fibre and autonomic neuropathy, and late-onset presenting with mixed sensorimotor axonal neuropathy and cardiomyopathy.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Presented with small sensory fibre and autonomic neuropathy.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: In the typical, early-onset cases, it presents with a small sensory fibre and autonomic, length-dependent, axonal neuropathy.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Mixed sensorimotor axonal neuropathy and cardiomyopathy.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: In late-onset cases, it presents with a length-dependent sensorimotor axonal neuropathy involving all fibre sizes.
In non-endemic areas, late-onset patients (age of onset after 50 years) are more common.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Small sensory fibre and autonomic neuropathy.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patients with early onset FAP, defined as onset before the age of 50 years, usually present with typical small sensory fibre and autonomic neuropathy phenotype.

functional_data.summary: The p.Val50Met mutation is associated with a neuropathic phenotype and has been shown to affect TTR stability.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in endemic regions.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on clinical presentation and family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The penetrance of the p.Val50Met mutation varies by population and is influenced by genetic and epigenetic factors.
key_quotes: Disease penetrance may vary in different populations and is probably modulated by genetic and epigenetic factors.
The typical phenotype of early-onset p.Val50Met neuropathy presents with sharp shooting pains in the feet, nausea and early satiety.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR gene variants and penetrance were successfully extracted.
